text: 'Their food is excellent!\nand Leon makes the best coffee in the area

author: flicka Flicka
text: 'Wow
column5: very nice place but the cappuccino was fabulous! Well done Green Pear. Nice outdoor space as well. My coffee spot while in Hoboken!'

text: 'Breakfast sandwiches are delicious. Staff is friendly and knows their coffee. They use Lavazza beans üëç'

author: Candace Dipsey
text: 'Was looking on the map for a quick coffee/breakfast while waiting to be seen at PromptMD. I am glad I found this! It is a small cafe and only had one man working at the time
column5: but he was friendly and made a very delicious croissant breakfast sandwich. Good coffee as well. Would definitely recommend!'

author: Calvin Kwon
text: 'Simple cafe for breakfast/lunch items. Food is delicious and the staff is very friendly.'

author: Kate MacNamee
text: 'This place is amazing. Incredible coffee
column5: lovely staff
column6: targeted high quality menu
column7: and a delightful atmosphere. It‚Äôs rare to find a neighborhood spot like this. Keep up the good work!'

author: Heather Wahl
text: 'Croissants are homemade - excellent food!'

author: MAKO MORI
text: 'We had such a wonderful experience. There was only one guy working there. He was handling and cooking the delivery orders all by himself! So naturally
column5: the food took some time to come out. It‚Äôs a unique menu and vibe that just feels so wonderfully small-business like and we really enjoyed it. We could tell that the worker took pride in the food and the cafe!  Thats honestly the best to see. Wonderful experience and will be back. Thank you!'

author: Nicholas Canepa
text: 'Incredible food

author: Katelyn R
text: 'The lattes

author: Mary King
text: 'I‚Äôm vegetarian
column5: so there were several good options for me too. The service is friendly and efficient. Both of our meals were very tasty
column6: hot and of great quality. Tea and coffee were great quality too. This is somewhere we will return to soon.'

author: Charlie Baxter
text: "Good job! This coffee shop really has the best coffee that's best for me! Every time I come around here
column5: the staffs are very polite and even greeted me enthusiastically. The coffee was really good
column6: and thanks to this barista
column7: who does it very well. It was a good place to hang out with friends and family."

text: 'Quality food.'

author: Freddy Lezama

author: Sarah Pagliocco
text: 'Always enjoy spending some time at Green Pear Cafe! A really cozy spot

author: Sripathi Sridhar
text: 'Nice cozy cafe for a weekend brunch. The food is good and the staff are helpful. However
column5: the wait time was significant-  might have been a better experience during a less busy time of the day.'

author: Matt F
text: 'Great little spot
column5: just what I needed - sausage/egg/cheese on a croissant and a cup o coffee'

author: Jill
text: 'Delightful
column5: local
column6: idiosyncratic approach to dining.'

author: Gemma Kim
text: "I visited here many times as my go-to place. I always find the staff to be very friendly and hard working in general but every few times I encountered the owner at this place
column5: I just felt very un-welcomed and intimadated to stay. The look and the way you are treated by the owner and the whole vibe of the Cafe just changes a lot when the owner is around. I've been quite a regular customer despite the fact that I've experienced such an unpleasant treatment from the owner because the staff and their food are actually ok. But i really don't think I will be going back anymore.. I do not post any reviews but this time
column6: the rudeness of the owner's service was just really unbearable."

author: Ahmed Shehata
text: 'We ordered crepes
column5: a salmon omelette
column6: and coffee. I enjoyed the coffee and crepes. The salmon omelette tasted fishy and I could tell it wasn\'t fresh. It also tasted like they spilled the salt in it. The waitress should have amended my bill but she didn\'t
column7: so that is why I am rating this two stars.\n\nUpdate: Sadly
column8: I did not want to have to come back to this
column9: but I must defend my character and warn other customers. So I called later because the salmon did not sit in my stomach well. I am grateful to have not finished my food because from taking a small bite I felt nauseated. If I ate the entire thing
column10: I do not know what would have happened.\n\nObviously
column11: it is within a customers right to not pay for bad food. Further
column12: I only asked to have the salmon taken off the bill
column13: and not anything else which is generous being that the fish is bad and ruined my appetite. Neither did they offer to bring me some other entree. This comes down to my word against the owners word
column14: but please look to other reviews for similar complaints to further corroborate this experience. Please scroll through the questionable 5 star reviews to common complaints. Also
column15: please refer to the owners nasty response which is indicative of shoddy service.\n\nIf you look at my review
column16: not once did I insult anyone. The owner took it upon their self to call me "disrespectful"
column17: "spoiled" and even question my "consciousness". The owner does not know me to make these quick character judgments. Just because you order salmon every week does not verify your claim that my order was good or fresh.  Why would I leave a tip? For being being insulted or eating salmon that made me feel unwell?\n\nMoreover
column18: when I called to let them know  she became verbally abusive and threatened to she. If you could afford a lawyer you can afford to amend my bill. She told me over the phone that I was taste sampling local businesses. This is not true either. I was happy to take my friend to another restaurant where we enjoyed the food and happily paid the entire bill with a tip. Over the phone the owner did not handle my complaint effectively and was verbally abusive.\n\nAccidents happen all the time. Sometimes food is bad and sometimes that is out of our control. It is hard to run a small business. However
column19: the part you could have controlled and failed at miserably was the customer service.  All you had to do was fix the issue by amending the bill and not insult me and I would not have written this review.\n\nEquating my fair critique to leaving a nasty review is just a desperate attempt to defend bad behavior. You have my number to apologize and you can still amend the bill
column20: then all will be well. I would be more than happy to update my review and let everyone know that you apologized.\n\nAt first
column22: but now I am changing it to one for the dismal customer service. Simply
column23: as the owner has made clear
column24: it is not about the customer experience here.\n\nPros: Friendly staff
column26:
and crepes.

Cons: risk of being insulted by owner and getting sick from the salmon

If you're okay with being called names
column27: then this the cafe for you.\n\nUPDATE: The owner deleted their response where they insulted me'

text: 'Finally a place that focuses on quality! Not only is the coffee amazing and better than any other place in town but we recently had breakfast here and the food was outstanding. I had the tuna sandwich and my husband had the deluxe omelette with bacon

column15: and rose flavored water. A peanut butter cookie for final and all hit the spot tonight. Cozy special corner here in Hoboken. Go

author: Umang Mistry
text: 'I went to this cafe based on the reviews and my experience turned out quite the opposite..as soon as we were seated our eyes started watering and there was a strong smell of onions in the air..it was so bad that we could barely keep our eyes open. We saw that the other guests seated there were all facing the same issue
column5: so we pointed this out to the gentleman serving us and he just flat out told us "we are free to leave if we want because there\'s nothing he can do about it". When I told him that all the guests were having the same issue
column6: he rudely turned around and asked the guests at another table and when they confirmed it
column7: that\'s when he turned back to me and apologized and went back to the cooks to inform them. This was such a bad start to the entire experience that it just left a very bad taste in the mouth(metaphorically) and thereafter everything that we ordered
column8: just did not taste any good. We were tourists from Virginia and had come to NJ/NYC for the first time and we came to this cafe for brunch solely based on the reviwes
column9: but after this experience we\'re NEVER COMING BACK HERE AGAIN!!'

text: 'My boyfriend and I are visiting family in the area and we found Green Pear on google reviews. We absolutely LOVED this spot. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. It‚Äôs a smaller venue

author: Catelyn Lonergan
text: 'This is such a haven! Cozy and sweet surroundings. The people are amazing --the owners and staff incredibly pleasant to be around. Such a wonderfully picked menu; fresh
column5: healthy and appetizing! I always feel as if I am in a romantic cafe in Europe. Just go.'

text: 'Really chill

text: 'They will not serve you water! Forcing people (esp people ordering meals) to buy bottled water does not set a sustainable or welcoming vibe. We left and refuse to go back unless they change their policy. A shame
